header_summary:
Anthony Towns' analysis highlights a direct correlation between the introduction of new editors to the Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs) repository and an increase in productivity, as evidenced by a surge in merges from April to December 2024. The data points to a significant workload being managed by a few key editors, including Jon Atack and Murch, underscoring the need for a rotational editorial system to avoid burnout and ensure a fresh perspective in managing the repository's efficiency. This approach suggests term limits and the introduction of an "apprenticeship" role for easing new editor recruitment, aiming to maintain the repository's vitality and responsiveness ([Source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/aJrSEOImKAa9NEB9@erisian.com.au/T/#m4294d050022bdd4c1c681ade3de7b3605d83be1a)).

Gmaxwell's examination into Minisketch's application in block relay processes offers insights into optimizing bandwidth and reducing data reconciliation costs, proposing a strategy that includes maintaining clones of peers' mempools to minimize policy discrepancies and conflict races. This method suggests significant improvements in block relay efficiency and memory usage, potentially reshaping how nodes communicate and manage transaction data ([Source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/sharing-block-templates/1906/8)).

The development of the Twinstor Blockchain, as introduced by VigSeth, leverages the Proof of Useful Work (PoUW) consensus mechanism for high-performance digital twin replication, targeting industries such as automobile and aerospace with an ambitious goal of over 1000 transactions per second (TPS). This project underscores the emerging trend of using blockchain technology for practical and industry-specific applications, beyond its traditional financial uses, indicating a significant shift towards broader technological integration and utility ([Source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/new-paper-on-proof-of-usable-work/1867/2)).

Niftynei's discussion on incorporating a universal sighash mode into Simplicity, a blockchain programming language, reveals an innovative approach to enhancing security and flexibility in transaction verification. This proposal emphasizes the importance of adaptability in blockchain development, potentially paving the way for more sophisticated smart contracts and blockchain solutions by allowing developers to create custom signature hashes ([Source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/writing-simplicity-programs-with-simplicityhl/1900/4)).

recent_posts.title: New BIP Editors: 1 Year Later
recent_posts.summary:
- Analysis shows fluctuating activity in BIPs, increasing with new editor additions.
- Jon Atack and Murch are notably active among editors contributing to merges.
- Proposal includes editor term limits and an "apprenticeship" role to prevent burnout.

recent_posts.title: Sharing block templates
recent_posts.summary:
- Minisketch improves block relay efficiency by focusing on set difference, not queue size.
- Alternatives to full reconciliation, like using recent templates for edits, enhance communication.
- Maintaining clones of peers' mempools could expedite block relay while minimizing memory usage.

recent_posts.title: New paper on Proof of Usable Work
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposed "Twinstor Blockchain" uses PoUW for better digital twin tech in major industries.
- It aims for over 1000 TPS to enhance scalability and performance significantly.
- Stakeholders are invited to collaborate, with project details available for download to facilitate engagement.

recent_posts.title: Writing Simplicity Programs with SimplicityHL
recent_posts.summary:
- The universal sighash mode in Simplicity enhances security and enables custom signature hashes.
- Its integration requires detailed planning and significant coding and testing efforts.
- This feature could advance blockchain development by offering more sophisticated smart contracts.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Utreexo Nodes
active_posts.summary:
- Tadge Dryja, Davidson Souza, and Calvin introduced three Bitcoin Improvement Proposals for Utreexo.
- Utreexo enhances Bitcoin by allowing verification without the full UTXO set, improving efficiency.
- The proposals aim for community feedback and have been made available on GitHub for discussion.

active_posts.title: New BIP Editors: 1 Year Later
active_posts.summary:
- The addition of new BIP Editors significantly increased BIP process activity and efficiency.
- The integration of new editors led to a dramatic rise in comments, PR merges, and BIP assignments.
- Despite progress, an uneven workload among BIP Editors suggests a need for team adjustments.

active_posts.title: Correcting the error in getnetworkhashrateps
active_posts.summary:
- The current hash rate calculation overestimates due to a statistical error.
- A correction method involving adjusting the estimation formula is proposed.
- An alternative suggests measuring hash rate over fixed time for accuracy.

active_posts.title: Exploring Extended Relative Timelocks
active_posts.summary:
- Discussions on extending Bitcoin timelocks aim for ~10 years to meet user demands.
- A proposed method suggests using bit 21 in `nSequence` for "long" timelocks, multiplying duration.
- The exploration includes a developed tool and code for experimentation with extended timelocks.

active_posts.title: Changing the minimum relay feerate
active_posts.summary:
- A proposal suggests lowering Bitcoin Core's minimum relay feerate from 1000 sat/kB to 100 sat/vB.
- The reduction aims to accommodate transactions below 1 sat/vB, noting blocks with many such transactions slow node propagation.
- The discussion highlights balancing low transaction costs with protection against DoS attacks and the impact of Bitcoin price fluctuations.

today_in_history_posts.title: Bitcoin XTs Tor IP blacklist downloading system has significant privacy leaks.
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin XT downloads Tor IPs for blacklisting, risking user privacy.
- It leaks real locations despite using proxies or Tor, offering no real protection.
- Its anti-DoS measures fail, allowing nodes to be identified and crashed.

today_in_history_posts.title: Loop attack with onion routing..
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell warns of a harmful Bitcoin Lightning Network attack involving payment routing manipulation.
- He suggests a solution involving peeling the onion to expose route step hashes and requiring nonce proof.
- Russell seeks feedback on this approach and acknowledges a transaction fee as a disincentive for closing channels.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies include passive (no active management) and active (direct engagement) types.
- Passive investment may lead to societal issues like asset underutilization and principal/agent conflicts.
- The article explores stabilizing economies with a currency system blending inflationary and deflationary currencies.
